page.title: 07HISTORY OF THE HARBOUR
page.content:
THE MAIN FUNCTION OF BUCKIE HAVE ALWAYS BEEN ASSOCIATED WITH THE SEA.BUCKIE DOES NOT HAVE A GREAT NATURAL HARBOUR. BUT IT BECAME IMPORTANT IN THE 18TH CENTURY AS A CENTRE OF FISHING ACTIVITY. SETTLEMENTS GREW UP ON EITHER SIDE OF, AND OVERLOOKING THE MOUTH OF, THE BUCKIE BURN. A WOODEN HARBOUR WAS BULIT IN 1843 BUT THIS WAS SWEPT AWAY IN A STORM. IN 1855 BUCKPOOL BUCKPOOL HARBOUR WAS BUILT AND SOON PROVED INADEQUATE BUCKIE'S HARBOUR IS CLUNY HARBOUR. WHICH WAS COMPLETED IN 1877 AT A COST OF Â£6OO,OOO.THE FISHING INDUSTRY EXPANDED TO A MASSIVE DEGREE.
CONT._
